text: THE wild bee reels from bough to bough%% With his furry coat and his gauzy wing.
With his furry coat and his gauzy wing. Now in a lily-cup, and now
Now in a lily-cup, and now%% Setting a jacinth bell a-swing,
Setting a jacinth bell a-swing, In his wandering;
In his wandering; Sit closer love: it was here I trow
Sit closer love: it was here I trow%% I made that vow,
I made that vow, Swore that two lives should be like one
Swore that two lives should be like one%% As long as the sea-gull loved the sea,
As long as the sea-gull loved the sea, As long as the sunflower sought the sun,--
As long as the sunflower sought the sun,-- It shall be, I said, for eternity
It shall be, I said, for eternity%% 'Twixt you and me!
'Twixt you and me! Dear friend, those times are over and done,
Dear friend, those times are over and done, Love's web is spun.
Love's web is spun. Look upward where the poplar trees
Look upward where the poplar trees%% Sway and sway in the summer air,
Sway and sway in the summer air, Here in the valley never a breeze
Here in the valley never a breeze%% Scatters the thistledown, but there
Scatters the thistledown, but there%% Great winds blow fair
Great winds blow fair%% From the mighty murmuring mystical seas,
From the mighty murmuring mystical seas, And the wave-lashed leas.
And the wave-lashed leas. Look upward where the white gull screams,
Look upward where the white gull screams, What does it see that we do not see?
What does it see that we do not see? Is that a star? or the lamp that gleams
Is that a star? or the lamp that gleams%% On some outward voyaging argosy,--
On some outward voyaging argosy,-- Ah! can it be
Ah! can it be%% We have lived our lives in a land of dreams!
We have lived our lives in a land of dreams! How sad it seems.
How sad it seems. Sweet, there is nothing left to say
Sweet, there is nothing left to say%% But this, that love is never lost,
But this, that love is never lost, Keen winter stabs the breasts of May
Keen winter stabs the breasts of May%% Whose crimson roses burst his frost,
Whose crimson roses burst his frost, Ships tempest-tossed
Ships tempest-tossed%% Will find a harbour in some bay,
Will find a harbour in some bay, And so we may.
And so we may. And there is nothing left to do
And there is nothing left to do%% But to kiss once again, and part,
But to kiss once again, and part, Nay, there is nothing we should rue,
Nay, there is nothing we should rue, I have my beauty,--you your Art,
I have my beauty,--you your Art, Nay, do not start,
Nay, do not start, One world was not enough for two
One world was not enough for two%% Like me and you.
